result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution is ordered in the amount of $138.00 to be paid to Macy's.

- DNA sample and DNA surcharge is mandatory and assessed if not already done.
- Payment of the surcharges, costs, fees and restitution are to be collected by the DOC from all applicable prison funds and wages, in an amount or a percentage which the Department determines is reasonable, as well as during any applicable period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment - payment must be made by October 24, 2017.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 392 days time served.  A time served disposition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet
Bail refund packet

Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in court with attorney John c Glover.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

State complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 392 days time served.  A time served disposition.  

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $138.00 to be paid to Macy's.    

- DNA sample and DNA surcharge is mandatory and assessed if not already done.
- Payment of the surcharges, costs, fees and restitution are to be collected by the DOC from all applicable prison funds and wages, in an amount or a percentage which the Department determines is reasonable, as well as during any applicable period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment - payment must be made by October 24, 2017.  

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Defendant would like to proceed with a projected guilty plea.  Defendant sworn.  

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to amended information as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   DNA notification given.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.

Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in court with attorney John c Glover.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Case calendared for final pretrial conference.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 26.   Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is denied by the court.

Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  The state requested an adjournment of the trial.   No objection from defense.   Defendant has trial date in another court, defense asked that we schedule after that trial.   The Court grants the adjournment.   Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to adjourn, filed.

Attorney John c Glover in court, defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Parties requests an adjournment of the trial.  Defendant has a pending trial in another court.  The Court grants the adjournment.    Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Felony Scheduling Order, signed and filed.

Attorney John c Glover in court, defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defense counsel in court to reschedule dates previously scheduled from another court.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on January 11, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26. Parties advised to contact Branch 26 forthwith to address the future court dates currently set. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Branch 25 is now down on the final pretrial date currently set. Parties notified. Court vacated the final pretrial date of 1/15/16. Case adjourned to 2/18/15 at 1:30 p.m. for Final Pretrial in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE ROTHSTEIN. Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel is not prepared to proceed today and requested final pretrial and jury trial dates. All motions have previously been litigated. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a return on warrant.   Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.   Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Parties notified this matter needs to be scheduled for a return on warrant date. Defense counsel advised the Court the defendant has significant cash bail set on another pending matter and does not object to this matter being scheduled farther out. Case adjourned to 10/12/15 at 1:30 p.m. for Return on Warrant in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

NO COURT FILE IN COURT. Case called to address Justice Point violation. Defendant absconded after being told by Justice Point to report to court to address the violation. State requested an increase in bail. Defense counsel requested a warrant be issued and bail not be increased at this time.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered cash bail on deposit be forfeited. Court vacated the final pretrial date of 9/03/15 and jury trial date of 10/28/15.

Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in court with attorney John c Glover.  Karen Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arguments as to discovery addressed on the record.  The Court ordered the case set for jury trial.  If Motions are to be filed, movants have until August 5, 2015 to file.  Respondents have to  August 25, 2015 and Reply due on August 31, 2015.  All Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions and Witness Lists as well as substantive jury instructions are to be filed one week prior to the final pretrial date.  A pretrial conference on September 3, 2015 at 8:30am.  A jury trial has been set for October 28, 2015 at 9:00am.  Parties are advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be assigned to Honorable Stephanie G. Rothstein, Br. 25, Room G-55 in CJF.

records.addlTxt: TOT to Justice Point: no drugs or alcohol; no firearms or weapons; random drug testing.  All No Contact Orders remain in effect.

Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's Justice Point violations addressed.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set bail at $250.00 cash.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Violation report received and filed.

Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in court with attorney Terese Dick for Victoria Mccandless.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Justice Point caseworker Meghan W. contacted the court over the noon hour and advised defendant tested positive. Case was passed to 1:30 p.m.   Justice Point violation report received and gone over by all parties.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonished defendant and warned that further usage would result in a change in bail.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and ordered case adjourned to the next court date previously set for June 25, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. before Branch 20.

Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel requested another scheduling conference date.  Court granted defense request and ordered case continued before Branch 20. 

Defendant's Justice Point violation addressed (baseline).  Court warned defendant that further non-compliance may result in change in cash bail.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Scott Fitzgerald Ferguson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Ronald Dague for Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/13/15.
